a.title: LISD Nurses Volunteer for COVID-19 Response

div.div: LISD Nurses Volunteer for COVID-19 Response

div.img: Seeing an opportunity to help their community, 12 Leander ISD nurses have stepped up to help with Williamson Countyâs COVID-19 response.

div.div: Read More about LISD Nurses Volunteer for COVID-19 Response

a.title: Feedback Needed on Remote Learning Experience

div.div: Feedback Needed on Remote Learning Experience

div.img: What's happening in your homes? As we continue to move forward through emergency distance learning, we would love to hear form you. While the governor's plans include reopening Texas, he also ordered school buildings remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

div.div: Read More about Feedback Needed on Remote Learning Experience

a.title: ‘Unexpected Art Contest’ Surprises with inspiring Works

div.div: ‘Unexpected Art Contest’ Surprises with inspiring Works

div.img: School closures have flung the doors wide open for student creativity! Since March, the LISD Council of PTAs has hosted a weekly "Unexpected Art Contest." Dozens of LISD students have flexed their imagination, painting, drawing, taking pictures or writing a poem.

div.div: Read More about ‘Unexpected Art Contest’ Surprises with inspiring Works

a.title: Update #23: Progress and Report Card Information; Surveys for parents, teachers and students; Board Briefs

div.div: Update #23: Progress and Report Card Information; Surveys for parents, teachers and students; Board Briefs

div.img: In this week's update, we're sharing information on report cards and how progress is being measures, a survey for parents on remote learning, and what's happening in our latest board meetings with budget, bell schedules and construction planning.

div.div: Read More about Update #23: Progress and Report Card Information; Surveys for parents, teachers and students; Board Briefs
Board Briefs: April 23, 2020

div.img: Construction and capital improvement plans from the 2017 bond will continue after the Board approved the borrowing and the construction agreements for several remaining projects during their regular meeting.

div.div: Read More about Board Briefs: April 23, 2020

a.title: Announcing Wendy Sturdevant as Canyon Ridge Middle School Principal

div.div: Announcing Wendy Sturdevant as Canyon Ridge Middle School Principal

img.alt: Announcing Wendy Sturdevant as CRMS Principal

div.img: Canyon Ridge Middle School has a new leader at the helm. Vandegrift High School associate principal Wendy Sturdevant will take the reins as principal of CRMS. The Leander ISD Board of Trustees selected Sturdevant at Thursday night's board meeting.

div.div: Read More about Announcing Wendy Sturdevant as Canyon Ridge Middle School Principal
Board Briefs: Budget Workshop April 22, 2020

div.img: In a workshop discussion focused on proposed compensation plan recommendations, Trustees considered and discussed the ramifications of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) global pandemic. The board's interest in the safety and wellbeing of both students and employees was clearly evident in the discussion. Chief Financial Officer, Elaine Cogburn and Chief Human Resources Officer, Karie Lynn McSpadden presented a coordinated package of personnel and budget options for the board to consider.

div.div: Read More about Board Briefs: Budget Workshop April 22, 2020

a.title: Staff Spotlight of the Week: April 22, 2020

div.div: Staff Spotlight of the Week: April 22, 2020

div.img: Introducing the Leander ISD Staff Spotlight. Read about some of our exceptional staff nominated for exemplifying the Leander Way!

div.div: Read More about Staff Spotlight of the Week: April 22, 2020

a.title: Episode 5: Let’s Talk, Learn, and Have Fun with Bruce & Friends

div.div: Episode 5: Let’s Talk, Learn, and Have Fun with Bruce & Friends

img.alt: Let's Talk, Learn, and Have Fun with Bruce & Friends

div.img: During the show, district leadership talked about report cards and how learning will be measured and communicated. The school district is also looking at plans for graduation. Leander ISD Superintendent Bruce Gearing, Ed.D. also talked about how the district is moving forward in the direction of "business as usual."

div.div: Read More about Episode 5: Let’s Talk, Learn, and Have Fun with Bruce & Friends

a.title: Update #22: Classrooms to Remain Closed for 2019-20 School Year, Zoom Forums Next Week, Board Briefs

div.div: Update #22: Classrooms to Remain Closed for 2019-20 School Year, Zoom Forums Next Week, Board Briefs

div.img: All school classrooms will remain closed for students through the end of the 2019-20 school year, Gov. Greg Abbott announced earlier today. In his press conference on the state's response to the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) global pandemic, the Governor directed school districts to Texas Education Agency (TEA) Commissioner Mike Morath for guidance on graduation and other operational decisions tied to the extended closure.

div.div: Read More about Update #22: Classrooms to Remain Closed for 2019-20 School Year, Zoom Forums Next Week, Board Briefs
